page.title: 14LARKSWOOD POOL IN CHINGFORD
page.content: Larkswood is an outdoor pool.It is shaped like a cross.It is 78 metres long and 24 metres wide at the narrow- est point and 60 metres at the widest point.The diving area is 8ft9 and the shallowest is 3ft. The building started in 1935 and was completed in 1936.The water is circulated througha plant.In 1936 the whole property was worth 1\ million pounds,nowadays it is worth 10 million pounds!There used to be a water slide and a restaurant.The most people they have ever had in one day is 17,000 in 1975.OAp's and under 5's don't have to pay. There have been 2 deaths.Occasionally,the police have to be called because of fighting.More younger people than older go to the pool.mon-sat there are 6 life guards, on sunday there are 10.There is a lady life guard now.
